the act of sending something to another country for sale: for exportation These crates have been packed for exportation. Since 1827, Mexico has prohibited the exportation of archaeological items.
the spreading of something such as an idea from one country into another country: An empire is based upon the exportation of ideology. America's global exportation of its popular culture See
export
More examplesFewer examplesThe law tightly regulates the exportation of weapons.They are against live animal exportation. The Irish were instrumental in the exportation of Catholicism throughout the globe.
